title: A Complete Guide to 👎 (Thumbs Down Emoji)

steps.title: The 👎 (thumbs down emoji) signifies disagreement or disapproval.
steps.content: The 👎 (thumbs down emoji) signifies disagreement or disapproval. When someone sends a 👎 (thumbs down emoji) over text or on social media, they’re expressing direct disagreement or disapproval with something that was sent or posted. [1] X Research source Person A: “Habanero peppers and chocolate go together like peanut butter and jelly” Person B: “👎👎👎”

steps.title: The 👎 (thumbs down emoji) can be a quick way of saying “no.”
steps.content: The 👎 (thumbs down emoji) can be a quick way of saying “no.” If someone texts a question to another person, the recipient can use 👎 (thumbs down emoji) as a quick way to say no. Person A: “Are you usually free on Fridays?” Person B: “👎”

steps.title: Share your disagreement or disapproval with 👎 (thumbs down emoji).
steps.content: Share your disagreement or disapproval with 👎 (thumbs down emoji). See an opinion or post that just doesn’t sit right with you? Show how you’re feeling with a 👎 (thumbs down emoji), or drop a few of this emoji if you’re feeling especially passionate. “👎👎👎 No way you thought it was a good idea to post this” Celebrity: “I just wanted to apologize to all my fans who I’ve let down.” You: “Too little, too late 👎👎”

steps.title: Say “no” quickly with 👎 (thumbs down emoji).
steps.content: Say “no” quickly with 👎 (thumbs down emoji). Maybe a friend is trying to make plans with you, or a conversation is going down in the group chat that requires a quick opinion. The 👎 (thumbs down emoji) is a fast and easy way to share your thoughts without having to type anything out. Friend: “So, is 11:00 a good time for everyone?” You: “👎”

steps.title: Send a message that makes sense with the conversational flow.
steps.content: Send a message that makes sense with the conversational flow. The 👎 (thumbs down emoji) can be used in a lot of different contexts, so there isn’t a cut-and-dry way to reply every time this emoji is used. Follow your gut—a simple reply often works well! Person A: “He doesn’t deserve all the heat he’s getting online” Person B: “Hard disagree 👎 He deserves to be held accountable for his actions!” Person A: “OK, you have a point there…”

steps.title: Not necessarily, but it depends on the context.
steps.content: Not necessarily, but it depends on the context. While a 👎 (thumbs down emoji) can be a sign of anger and upset feelings in some contexts, this isn’t always the case. Chances are, a person isn’t that upset if they’re dropping a single 👎 (thumbs down emoji), but they might be bothered if that emoji is accompanied by a sentence or two of impassioned text. Probably not upset: “👎” Probably upset: “👎👎👎 I can’t believe you’d post something like this! I’m so tired of seeing this picture being shared everywhere.”

steps.title: 👍 (Thumbs up emoji)
steps.content: 👍 (Thumbs up emoji) Think of the 👍 (thumbs up emoji) as the polar opposite 👎 (thumbs down emoji)—it represents approval, agreement, and “yes.”

steps.title: 👌 (OK hand emoji)
steps.content: 👌 (OK hand emoji) The 👌 (OK hand emoji) is shorthand for “yes,” and can also mean “I’m good” or “that’s correct.” [2] X Research source

steps.title: 🤞 (Crossed fingers emoji)
steps.content: 🤞 (Crossed fingers emoji) The 🤞 (crossed fingers emoji) symbolizes the act of wishing someone good luck or hoping for a good result. [3] X Research source
